prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will my fated union with Stefan occur, if so, exactly when?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a list of all chart data relevant to your horary query using strictly horary principles. In this reading, you (Melissa Gale) are represented by the Ascendant, and Stefan is indicated by the 9th house (with its cusp in Virgo and Mercury as its ruling planet). I have organized the data into sections for clarity.

1. Querent (Melissa Gale) – Ascendant Data:
 • Ascendant: 25°58′ Sagittarius
 • Lord of the Ascendant (ruler of Sagittarius) is Jupiter, located at 11°16′ Gemini in the 6th house.
 • Relevant aspects involving the Ascendant:
  – Ascendant Sextile MC (orb: 5°)
  – North Node Square Ascendant (orb: 4°)
  – Moon Trine Ascendant (orb: 8°)
  – Chiron Trine Ascendant (orb: 6°)
  – Venus Square Ascendant (orb: 5°)
  – Neptune Square Ascendant (orb: 3°)

2. Stefan Representation – 9th House Data:
 • 9th House cusp: 15° Virgo (by house division provided)
 • Ruling planet for Virgo is Mercury.
 • Mercury’s position: 12°7′ Aquarius (located in the 2nd house)
 • Key aspect of Mercury:
  – Sun Conjunction Mercury (orb: 3°)
  – Mercury Trine Jupiter (orb: 1°)
  – Mercury Trine MC (orb: 8°)

3. Critical Planetary Positions:
 • Sun: 15°49′ Aquarius
 • Moon: 3°42′ Taurus
 • Venus: 0°3′ Aries
 • Mars: 19°31′ Cancer (retrograde)
 • Saturn: 17°47′ Pisces
 • Uranus: 23°16′ Taurus
 • Neptune: 28°4′ Pisces
 • Pluto: 2°9′ Aquarius
 • North Node: 29°40′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron: 19°36′ Aries

4. Major Aspects Involving Key Significators:
 • Venus Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°) – suggests a destined or fated quality.
 • Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°) – reinforces the karmic thread.
 • Mars Square Chiron (orb: 0°) – indicates urgent challenges or potential wounds affecting the query.
 • Mars Square MC (orb: 1°) and Mars Square IC (orb: 1°) – stressing tension between public and personal domains.
 • Moon Square Pluto (orb: 1°) – a dynamic that can intensify emotions.
 • Chiron Opposition MC (orb: 1°) and Conjunction IC (orb: 1°) – key structural markers in the T-square.
 • Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 2°) – a stabilizing influence amidst tension.
 • Pluto Sextile North Node (orb: 3°) – indicating transformative connections.

5. Patterns Identified:
 • T-Square:
  – Involves MC (20° Libra), Mars (19° Cancer), IC (20° Aries) with Chiron (19° Aries) on the apex.
 • Multiple Planet Square:
  – Involves North Node (29° Pisces), Ascendant (25° Sagittarius), Neptune (28° Pisces), and Venus (0° Aries)
 • Yods:
  – One Yod between Uranus (23° Taurus), MC (20° Libra), and Ascendant (25° Sagittarius)
  – A second Yod between MC (20° Libra), Uranus (23° Taurus), and Saturn (17° Pisces)

6. House Placements of Note:
 • Lower right quadrant dominance – most planets fall here, suggesting a projection outward from personal concerns.
 • The top left quadrant is empty – a factor to note in terms of initiative or action.
 • Chiron and the IC are located on the Nadir – highlighting the role of personal wounds and foundational matters in the query.
 • The bowl-shaped chart configuration emphasizes the flow from the Ascendant onward.

7. Timing and Destiny Indicators:
 • Mercury’s role as the 9th house ruler (representing Stefan) positioned at 12°7′ Aquarius is critical.
 • Positive aspects between Mercury and Jupiter (meaning and expansion) suggest a favorable connection.
 • The conjunctions involving Venus and Neptune with the North Node point to destined or fated ties.
 • The tight aspects (especially the ones with orbs near 0°) emphasize urgency in the matter.

This list compiles all the key quantitative and qualitative chart data available for your horary query. You may now document these details for further interpretative steps.

This list compiles all the key quantitative and qualitative chart data available for your horary query. You may now document these details for further interpretative steps.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the horary data and the strict application of traditional principles, the following interpretation is offered regarding your query about a fated union with Stefan:

1. Fated Energy and Destiny
 • The conjunction of Venus with the North Node (orb 1°) and Neptune’s close alignment with that Node point clearly to a destined or karmic link. The energy is unmistakably marked by fate.
 • These configurations reveal that the soul of your inquiry is attuned to events that, although potentially challenging, are not meant to be permanently thwarted.

2. Significators and Their Status
 Querent (Melissa Gale):
  – Your Ascendant in Sagittarius, with its lord Jupiter positioned in Gemini (6th house), indicates a query rooted in personal commitment mixed with everyday routine. Jupiter’s trines with Mercury (representing Stefan) add a supportive tone.
Stefan (signified by the 9th house cusp in Virgo and ruled by Mercury placed in Aquarius):
  – Mercury’s placement in the 2nd house yet making key aspects (such as a tight conjunction with the Sun and a trine with Jupiter) supports the notion of communication or connection arising that is both significant and fated.

3. Dynamic Aspects and Patterns
 • The T-square involving the Midheaven (MC in Libra), Mars in Cancer, and the IC in Aries—with Chiron nearly conjunct both the IC and MC—reveals pressing tensions and wounds that may trigger emotional or psychological hurdles. This T-square underscores that while the union is fated, internal conflicts or external events (represented by Mars’ disruptive energy) may act as hurdles.
 • The Multiple Planet Square incorporating the North Node, Neptune, Venus, and your Ascendant further emphasizes the destined—but complex—nature of this union.
 • Additionally, Mercury’s harmonious trine with Jupiter (1° orb) reinforces that, despite these challenges, the intellectual and communicative connection linking you to Stefan is robust and supported.

4. Timing Considerations
 • The destined indicators (Venus–North Node and Neptune–North Node) pinpoint that when these energies activate the appropriate phase of your chart, the fated union will manifest.
 • Mercury (the key significator for Stefan) is in Aquarius at 12°7′. In horary techniques, the progression of Mercury through its degrees and its aspects often serves as a timing indicator. With Mercury’s current supportive aspects (especially its trine with Jupiter and connection to the MC via the Sun), a triggering event is suggested once conflict-ridden energies (Mars’ square points) resolve.
 • Considering the degree placements and the orb of influence in this chart, there is evidence pointing to a union manifesting after a period of tension—for instance, when transiting influences support a release of the T-square’s pressure. In practical terms, the chart suggests that as these challenging aspects alleviate (possibly through transits aligning favorably within the following three to four months), the fated union is most likely to emerge.
 • Thus, an interpretation would indicate a probable event in the early spring of 2025. With your chart drawn on February 4, 2025, and given the current configurations, expect that concrete developments regarding this union might occur by late March into April 2025, when Mercury and associated transiting energies activate the 9th-house matters in your chart.

5. Concluding the Interpretation
The horary chart strongly supports the idea that a fated union with Stefan is written in the stars. However, a period of tension, as indicated by the T-square and Mars-related aspects, must first be navigated. Once these challenges are processed, the supportive energy from Jupiter and the destined markers (Venus and Neptune with the North Node) will foster the alignment necessary for the union. The chart points to early spring 2025—specifically in the range of late March to April—as the likely window for this fated connection to come into clear manifestation.

Based on the horary data and the strict application of traditional principles, the following interpretation is offered regarding your query about a fated union with Stefan:

1. Fated Energy and Destiny
 • The conjunction of Venus with the North Node (orb 1°) and Neptune’s close alignment with that Node point clearly to a destined or karmic link. The energy is unmistakably marked by fate.
 • These configurations reveal that the soul of your inquiry is attuned to events that, although potentially challenging, are not meant to be permanently thwarted.

2. Significators and Their Status
 Querent (Melissa Gale):
  – Your Ascendant in Sagittarius, with its lord Jupiter positioned in Gemini (6th house), indicates a query rooted in personal commitment mixed with everyday routine. Jupiter’s trines with Mercury (representing Stefan) add a supportive tone.
Stefan (signified by the 9th house cusp in Virgo and ruled by Mercury placed in Aquarius):
  – Mercury’s placement in the 2nd house yet making key aspects (such as a tight conjunction with the Sun and a trine with Jupiter) supports the notion of communication or connection arising that is both significant and fated.

3. Dynamic Aspects and Patterns
 • The T-square involving the Midheaven (MC in Libra), Mars in Cancer, and the IC in Aries—with Chiron nearly conjunct both the IC and MC—reveals pressing tensions and wounds that may trigger emotional or psychological hurdles. This T-square underscores that while the union is fated, internal conflicts or external events (represented by Mars’ disruptive energy) may act as hurdles.
 • The Multiple Planet Square incorporating the North Node, Neptune, Venus, and your Ascendant further emphasizes the destined—but complex—nature of this union.
 • Additionally, Mercury’s harmonious trine with Jupiter (1° orb) reinforces that, despite these challenges, the intellectual and communicative connection linking you to Stefan is robust and supported.

4. Timing Considerations
 • The destined indicators (Venus–North Node and Neptune–North Node) pinpoint that when these energies activate the appropriate phase of your chart, the fated union will manifest.
 • Mercury (the key significator for Stefan) is in Aquarius at 12°7′. In horary techniques, the progression of Mercury through its degrees and its aspects often serves as a timing indicator. With Mercury’s current supportive aspects (especially its trine with Jupiter and connection to the MC via the Sun), a triggering event is suggested once conflict-ridden energies (Mars’ square points) resolve.
 • Considering the degree placements and the orb of influence in this chart, there is evidence pointing to a union manifesting after a period of tension—for instance, when transiting influences support a release of the T-square’s pressure. In practical terms, the chart suggests that as these challenging aspects alleviate (possibly through transits aligning favorably within the following three to four months), the fated union is most likely to emerge.
 • Thus, an interpretation would indicate a probable event in the early spring of 2025. With your chart drawn on February 4, 2025, and given the current configurations, expect that concrete developments regarding this union might occur by late March into April 2025, when Mercury and associated transiting energies activate the 9th-house matters in your chart.

5. Concluding the Interpretation
The horary chart strongly supports the idea that a fated union with Stefan is written in the stars. However, a period of tension, as indicated by the T-square and Mars-related aspects, must first be navigated. Once these challenges are processed, the supportive energy from Jupiter and the destined markers (Venus and Neptune with the North Node) will foster the alignment necessary for the union. The chart points to early spring 2025—specifically in the range of late March to April—as the likely window for this fated connection to come into clear manifestation.
